intro: Hibbertia glomerata subsp. ginginensis, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and woody stems, which are typical features of the Dilleniaceae family. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a shrub-like appearance with compound leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. The subspecies ginginensis is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from the main species.
